content.question: The photoelectron spectrum for the element nitrogen is represented above. Which of the following best explains how the spectrum is consistent with the electron shell model of the atom?

choices.label: The leftmost peak represents the valence electrons.
The two peaks at the right represent a total of three electrons.
The electrons in the <math alttext="1 s" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel have the smallest binding energy.
The electrons in the <math alttext="2 p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel have the smallest binding energy.

content.answer: The electrons in the <math alttext="2 p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> sublevel have the smallest binding energy.

skill.text: 4.B: Explain whether a model is consistent with chemical theories.
